title: Fun Run
description: Michael accidentally runs over Meridith in the parking lot, and his guilt causes him to organize a 5-K run for her. Dwight and Angela have a falling-out after he kills her cat, and Jim and Pam's relationship is discovered.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, well I did not get the job in New York, but I got the real prize, domestic bliss. Jan made me breakfast this morning... well she bought the milk. It's soy. [walks into bedroom, Jan sleeping on bed] This is why I do it, that's what I have to come home to. [sighs] She probably won't be up for a few hours.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is going to be a very good year. Very good. Jan is at home. Jim is back. My protege Ryan is at corporate. Good stuff. Um... Andy and Dwight are rockin' the sales team. I feel very blessed. [slams on breaks, camera turns, Meredith rolls off the hood]

quotes.speaker: IT Tech Guy
quotes.text: You know generally it's not a good idea to click on offers that you haven't requested. What was the exact offer?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It was for a video.

quotes.speaker: IT Tech Guy
quotes.text: Yeah, what kind of video?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: A celebrity sex tape.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really, what kind of celebrity?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Not relevant.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: How much did you pay for it?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Not relevant.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You paid for it?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It all happened so fast.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I broke up with Karen after the job interview, and uh... it was a little awkward when she came back from the city. She told me, very clearly, just because we were broken up didn't mean she was going anywhere, because she worked really hard for her career. But the next day her desk was empty, and as for me and my current romantic life, I uh... I'm single now and looking, so if you know anybody.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jim and I went to dinner a few times when he got back from New York. I talked him through his break up. It's really nice to be good friends again.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Are you kidding me, Pam and Jim are totally hooking up. All they do is smile; they're just keeping it a secret. Right? [looks at Oscar]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I don't know, there is no evidence of intimacy. They've been in remarkably good moods. It could be other things.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Are you kidding me?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And Sunday I'm thinking of going to that flea-market at the drive-in.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh that sounds fun. I'm mountain biking on Sunday. On Montage Mountain.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Cool.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well have fun with that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ladies and Gentlemen. I have some bad news. Meredith was hit by a car.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Where?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It happened this morning in the parking lot. I took her to the hospital, and the doctors tried to save her life. They did the best that they could... And she is going to be OK.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: What is wrong with you? Why did you have to phrase it like that?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: So she's really going to be fine?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes. She has a slight pelvical fracture, but, ah... people have survived far worse.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank God you were there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Did you see who did it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No need we can just check the security tapes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Gah. Kind of a good news bad news there. I was able to be on the scene so quickly because I was in the car that hit her.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Who was driving?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: One day Michael came in complaining about a speed bump on the highway. I wonder who he ran over then.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's only Meredith.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, it's only Meredith, thank God. But did you see the way they looked at me? Like I was a murderer or something.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey... Why did you do it?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It was an accident.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Was she talkin' back?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Did you get sick of that face? Did she owe you money? Uh-oh. Is this downsizing? Did she spurn your advances?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey guys, we're all gonna visit Meredith at lunch. And we're kicking in $5 for flowers.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Who's we, you and Jim?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, uh, me Stanley and Phyllis so far.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh, I bet Jim goes too.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, I haven't asked him yet.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh, I bet you ask?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I was planning on it.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I bet you were.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Angela?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [whispers to Kevin] Subtle.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to Angela] Are you coming?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I can't, Sprinkles is sick.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: She's been sick for some time. Thank you for asking, no one asks... about Sprinkles.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I have to give her her meds, I have to pet her, and who will she eat lunch with?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Can't your other cats keep her company.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: There's bad blood, jealousies, cliques.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Angela, you're the chairman of the party planning committee. I shouldn't even be planning this, it's your job.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [sighs] All right!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: My lord my liege.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yes Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So Ryan got promoted to corporate, where he is a little fish in a big pond. Whereas back here in Scranton I am still top dog, in a fairly large pond. So who is the real boss? The dog or a fish?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So I need a little treat for the gang. Something to win their affections back.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Back? Why is that Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I ran down Meredith in my car.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Oh! Did you do this on purpose?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, I was being negligent. But she's in the hospital, she's fine, recovering nicely. Tiny little crack in her pelvis. But she will be up in...

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Did this happen on company property?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes. It was on company property, with company property, so... double jeopardy, we are fine.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I don't think you understand how jeopardy works.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, right, I'm sorry. What is: we are fine?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [sigh]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: People keep calling me a "Wunderkind"; I don't even know what that means. I mean, I know what it means, it means very successful for your age, so I guess it makes sense, but... it's a weird word.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Hey D.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey monkey, what's up?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Can you do me a little favor? Go to my place at lunch and give Sprinkles her medicine.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I have to visit the alchy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Check to see if she's faking. If a car hit me, it wouldn't crack my pelvis. You know what; I bet she cracked it at home. Jumped in front of the car to get some workers comp.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I wouldn't put it past her.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So what do you need me to do?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I wrote it out.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: There's a diabetes shot, roll the insulin in your hand, don't shake it. She gets an ace inhibitor with her meal, but you have to put her right in front of the dish or she won't see it because of the cataracts. Mix one capsule of omega fatty acid in with her kidney medicine, um... and you want to give that to her 15 minutes after she's eaten. And, oh and there's a fungal cream because she has this infection under her tail, so you're gonna have to lift her tail and put the cream right at the base of her tail.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, I have an announcement.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You pushed Darryl out the window?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You shot Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No! That is not funny, I love my employees, even thought I hit one of you with my car. For which I take full responsibility. Look I'm just trying to take everybody's mind off of this unavoidable tragedy, and onto more positive things. So I thought we should plant a tree.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh good, so we don't have to work.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: OK, we're leaving for the hospital at 1.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So, like a freedom tree.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I can take 3 people.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I can also take 3 people.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [to Kevin] Separate cars.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Alright, I will get a card at the hospital and we'll sign it outside her room.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sales people can go later in the day. Hourly works can go at lunch.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, good good, so we'll just all go down there together at lunch.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Excellent!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I was thinking that we...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good work Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: But...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yaaaaaay, Pam! Alright, since I am the boss I will drive as well. Who wants shotgun?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: You can't be serious. You ran a woman over this morning.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Everyone inside the car was fine, Stanley!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Guess what, I have flaws. What are they? Oh, I don't know. I sing in the shower. Sometimes I spend too much time volunteering. Occasionally I'll hit somebody with my car. So sue me... No, don't sue me. That is the opposite of the point that I'm trying to make.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Eww. I hate hospitals. In my mind they are associated with sickness. Oh... She looks like an angel.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: She looks awful.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No... OK, she always looks like that... That is not my fault.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think she's awake.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No... She's in a coma.

quotes.speaker: Nurse
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK... Meredith, [hauntingly] Ooooohhhhh. I brought all your friends from the office dear.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: At the same time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Hello Meredith.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: This is weird.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Brought you some balloons. Why don't we... here you go. [wraps them around her IV] Tie these up, cheer up your tubes... [IV pops out] Oh! Shhhh... For God's sake!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Whoa!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nurse.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: No don't bother the nurse, just put it back in.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [groaning] I am going to be sick... I'm gonna puke.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I wouldn't... I wouldn't worry about it. Don't touch it.

quotes.speaker: Nurse
quotes.text: What, what are you doing? Just gimme that.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [applauds]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Does it hurt terribly?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: No, it's not too bad. They have me on a lot of painkillers.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Oh really, what kind? Codeine, Vicodin, Percocet, Fentanyl, Oxycontin, Palladone? What...

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I have no idea.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Oh. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Well it was really great of all of you to come and visit me at the same time. I'll see you guys at the office.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, OK... Wait up, wait up, guys guys guys, hold on a second. You know what I was thinking might be sort of fun? Is if you forgave me in front of everybody.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Michael, I'm not gonna do that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Cause you know what they say in the Bible about forgiveness? Forgiveness is next to Godliness.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No, that's not. That's next to cleanliness.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, just shhhh... just just...

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: You cracked my pelvis

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Look, I just... I don't understand what is preventing you from laughing this off and giving me a big hug.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: You're not forgiven.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on. [starts to climb onto the bed with meredith.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael! Michael!

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: [screams]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Do I need to be liked? Absolutely not. I like to be liked. I enjoy being liked. I have to be liked. But it's not like a compulsive need to be liked. Like my need to be praised.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey monkey.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Any problems?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well you left the TV on, and your cat is dead.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What!?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Sparkles, the white one, is dead.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Sprinkles.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That was the sick one, right?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Uh-huh. But I thought she had more time.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Did she look... When you saw her how was she looking?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Really dead. Like a... just a dead cat.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [sobbing]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So... Hey come on, don't be sad, just... OK... just. She's in a better place.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Actually the place that she's in is the freezer, because of the odor.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [still sobbing]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to Angela] It's gonna be OK.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, you know what? Everybody, let's just get over the whole Meredith thing. She cracked her pelvis, a tiny little crack. She going to be fine, so let's just...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, Angela's cat died.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Sprinkles?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [nods]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [sighs] Oh, sh... I'm sorry Angela. Man what a day huh? How could it get any worse? Her computer crashes with the porn, and then Meredith with the accident, and then... Sprinkles! God, that's 3 things. I'll tell you what's going on. This office is cursed, and we need to do something about it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I am taking responsibility. It is up to me to get rid of the curse that hit Meredith with my car. I'm not superstitious, but... I'm... I am a little-stitious.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Did anyone do anything involving an Indian burial ground?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Like what?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Like park on it. Or dig up a body... Toby? Anything you want to tell us?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: No, I did not violate an Indian burial ground. In fact I had some good luck recently, Alfredo's Pizza, picked my business card out of the basket, so... uh, I got a week of free pies.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That's cool.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Perfect. So our tragedy is your good luck. Satan.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Sprinkles never hurt a soul. God in your infinite wisdom how could you do this? She wasn't ready. She had so much left to accomplish.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: She's only a cat.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You never... you don't like them.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Cats do not provide milk or wool or meat.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Dwight please!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, you haven't seen Meredith yet, have you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, I have not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, I think you should go to the hospital, and pay your respects.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I do not respect her, but I will go.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright, I would now like to talk about each of your individual religious beliefs.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Oh, Michael, you can't ask about religious beliefs...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Satan is a master of lies. Everything he says is the opposite.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Alright, well then you can ask about religious beliefs.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thank you for the permission. Psych! Alright let's just go around the room, and tell me what you believe in.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I'm... um, Catholic.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Presbyterian.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh me too.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Oh?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [puts hand up for high five] Same religion.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Alright! [high fives Pam]

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I'm a Lutheran and Bob's a Unitarian. It keeps things spicy.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: That's why we're cursed.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I've been involved in a number of cults, both as a leader and a follower. You have more fun as a follower, but you make more money as a leader.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Kelly, you are Hindu, so you believe in Buddha.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: That's Buddhist.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Are you sure?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What are you?

quotes.speaker: IT Tech Guy
quotes.text: Well if you're going to reduce my identity to my religion then I'm Sikh, but I also like Hip-hop and NPR, and I'm restoring a 1967 Corvette in my spare time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, 1 Sikh, and...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: As a farmer, I know that when an animal is sick, sometimes the right thing to do is to put it out of its misery. With the electricity we're using to keep Meredith alive we could power a small fan for 2 days. You tell me what's unethical.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Blink once if you want me to pull the plug.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Don't pull any plugs.

quotes.speaker: Intern
quotes.text: How are you doing Ms. Palmer?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Better.

quotes.speaker: Intern
quotes.text: Excellent.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Are you a doctor, or a male nurse?

quotes.speaker: Intern
quotes.text: Um... I'm an intern, which makes me a doctor, but...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pfft... Her chart doesn't indicate that she had a hysterectomy but she did, or at least she got time off for one.

quotes.speaker: Intern
quotes.text: Ah, so uh... so that is where her uterus went... Um, Ms. Palmer, your last tetanus shot was when you were bitten by a bat a few months ago?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Yes. Dwight here, trapped it in a bag against my head.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Just doing my job.

quotes.speaker: Intern
quotes.text: It also says you were recently bitten by a raccoon?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: And a rat. Separate occasions.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You spend your whole life trying to get people to like you, and then you run over one person with your car. [sighs] And it's not even one of the popular ones, and everybody gets on your case. Doesn't make any sense... God is dead.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: If there was a God then Ryan and I would be married by now.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Maybe believing in God was the mistake. What did people believe in before? The sun? Maybe there's some sort of animal, that we could make a sacrifice too. Like a giant buffalo, or some sort of monster, like something with the body of a walrus with the head of a sea lion. Or something with the body of an egret with the head of a meerkat. Or just... the head of a monkey, with the antlers of a reindeer, with, ah... the body of a porcupine.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I will do some research.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I can help you with that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So, just to be safe they are giving her the rabies vaccine.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh God, Rabies?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I was in the hospital room with her. How contagious is that, is that like an STD?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, no. You've gotta be bitten by something.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This place is so cursed.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Actually the doctor said it was lucky she came in to the hospital, cause the only way to beat rabies, is to start treatment before the symptoms set in... Lock jaw.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [walks out into the office] I know a lot of you are upset with me for endangering Meredith's life by hitting her, with my car. But it may make you feel a little better to know that before that happened, Dwight endangered her life, by putting a garbage bag over her head that had a bat in it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Six of one, really.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Turns out Meredith has been exposed to rabies. Which is like 10 times worse than a little crack in your pelvis. Thanks to me she went to the hospital and I saved her life. Curse is broken. Curse is broken people! [Kevin claps] Oh... there is a God, and he has a plan for us after all. So go home get some rest, very very good work today. We got a lot accomplished.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Is there a God? If not, what are all the churches for? And who is Jesus' dad?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [Pam walks out of the office into the parking lot alone. Kevin pops up from the back seat of his car as if spying] Oh well, if they aren't together now, then they probably never will be. I thought they'd be good together, like PB&J. Pam Beasley and Jim. What a waste. What - A - Waste!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Pam's car pulls out of parking lot and then off to the side of the road] I told you I'm not dating anyone. And even if I was, I don't think it's anyone's business. I mean, when I do fall in love, like when it's for real, the last person I'm gonna talk about it too is a camera crew, or my co-workers. [Jim gets into the passenger side] Almost marrying Roy Anderson was as close to Pamela Anderson as I ever want to be. [Jim leans over and kisses Pam] Trust me, when I fall in love, you'll know.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael Scott's Dunder-Mifflin, Scranton, Meredith Palmer memorial, celebrity rabies awareness, fun run race for the cure, this is Pam.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pro-Am.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Pro-Am race for the... They hung up.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: A woman shouldn't have to be hit by a car, to learn that she may have rabies. But that is where we are in America. And that does not sit right with me. And that is why I'm hosting a fun run race for the cure for rabies. To raise awareness of the fact that there is a cure for rabies. A disease that has largely been eradicated in the US. But not very many people know that.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: [on the phone] No, rabies... Babies would be a good idea. Can I put you down for a dime?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hi Stanley, how many sponsors so far?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Zero.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on man, gotta step it up! It's for a good cause. Jan called this morning and pledged $500.00.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Isn't that your money?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That... is for a good cause. Phyllis, how's the rabies quilt coming?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, it's coming.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, look at that, 3. Way to honor Meredith, Phyllis.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: You cannot make me run.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK. [walks away]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: It is not a real charity. It's stupid Michael, and I'm not gonna do it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright, alright.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: You didn't run for me...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shhh...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: ...when I thought I had skin cancer.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I know that you're probably scared of people seeing your fat legs in shorts.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, well back in olden times, a large fat person, like this, was a person of power. A person who had money, could buy food, person of respect. Like the regional manager of the day. Whereas, someone athletic and trim, like myself, was someone who worked in the fields... And I was a peasant.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I just don't want to run. I didn't bring my sneakers or my clothes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, you're going to have to run, or you're going to be in a lot of trouble. It is not olden times anymore.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [in bathroom] I'm petrified of nipple chafing. Once it starts it is a vicious circle. If you have sensitive nipples, they chafe, so they become more sensitive, so they chafe more. So... I take precautions. [tapes a cotton ball to each nipple]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey Angela. Hey, um... I'm sorry about your cat. [Angela starts to cry]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: This is Sprinkles. [holds up a picture] She was my best friend. I kept her going through countless ailments. I asked Dwight Schrute to feed her once, and she is now deceased. This is Halloween last year, [picture of Angela holding Sprinkles] just a couple of kittens [starts to cry] out on the town.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Pssst. I'm having relationship problems. And since you're always having relationship problems, I thought you'd be able to give me some advice.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What's wrong?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I have this crazy thought, that I know is crazy. That maybe Dwight killed my cat.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hmm...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: When I got home, Sprinkles' body was in the freezer where Dwight said he left her, but all my bags of frozen french fries had been clawed to shreds.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ah.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Something's not right. The vet's doing an autopsy.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Angela, I'm sorry.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Did Roy ever kill one of your cats?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm more of a dog person.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [sighs]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So what's your strategy for this race?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well I'm gonna start fast.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Then I'm gonna run fast in the middle.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Then I'm gonna end fast.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Why won't more people do that? [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Cause they're just stupid.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [looks at camera] What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Pam and Jim watch video of their kiss on the tv] Oh, ah... No that's not... I mean that wasn't, ah...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah... That was um...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I mean I can see how it would seem a bit like we uh... How it looks like um... I mean now a days you can edit anything, right? I mean you can edit anything to look like um... anything.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, I gave him a ride home because...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Right!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: ... We're dating.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow! There it is.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ah, yeah. We haven't told anybody, but it's going really great. [looks at Jim] Right?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It is going really great.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [Angela runs into Dwight] Oww!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Shut up.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're taking this out on me, but I was only the messenger.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh, really?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [sighs] You'll feel better after the 5k. Exercise is good for depression.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [pushes her chair into Dwight's legs] I'm not depressed I'm in grief.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We have raised, almost $700.00, most of it from me and Jan. Um... when do they put that on the giant check? Or is that something that we write in later?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well a giant check costs about $200.00 to make up. I have a print shop standing by but... What do you think Michael, that's over 25% of our funds?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hmm... That's a tough decision. Um... I always imagined it with a giant check. So...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, I mean I personally am definitely on board for the giant check.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Giant check it is.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well I don't know, on the other hand it does leave less money for bat birth control.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Bat birth control

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wait, this money is going to bat birth control, right Michael, that's what you told me when I contributed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You didn't contribute very much. I was also hoping to hand the giant check to a rabies doctor. And how's that been going?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Not well. A doctor won't come out to collect a check for $700.00, or $500.00 if we go with the giant check.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Which we are.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And also there is no such thing as a rabies doctor.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What about a rabies nurse?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't think so.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know what though, I've actually seen ads for nurses that you can hire by the hour, for parties and bachelor events.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's possible. Look into that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Great, it's gonna cost a couple a hundred buck and ah... oh actually more with tips.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Maybe we should just skip the ceremony and setup a college fund for Meredith's son.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Have you met that kid? He's not going to college.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael, 5k means 5 kilometers, not 5 thousand miles. [knocks]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come in.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, hey, hey

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my God.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You said come in!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No I didn't, just please don't...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my God.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So I closed the door but the image of his...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Baquette.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: ... dangling participle...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Eww.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: ... still burned in my eyes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I can imagine.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [Michael knocks slowly on door] Come in.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: May I enter the room?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes. Or come in.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: See how I did that. That's the way you should enter a room. You knock and then you wait for the all clear.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You couldn't have taken off all your clothes in the men's room?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes, but I have an office, so why would I do that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: On average, how many hours a day do you spend naked in your office? Just ballpark.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: European offices are naked all the time.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: They're so not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Besides my shirt tail covered most of it so...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I didn't see where it started but I saw where it ended.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [sighs] Gross.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's not gross, it is the human body. What is your problem? Pam you're an artist, right? Think of me as one of your models. OK, you know what, I don't want this to detract from what we really need to be thinking about today, it's not fair to people with rabies. And that's the point, right? OK, let's go have some fun.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: They say if you're nervous around someone you should picture them naked. I do not recommend this strategy. Try picturing them with more clothes on... or a funny coat.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [naked from chest up] Oh, I'm sorry, is this a working office, and not a French beach?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: OK, name please.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Creed Bratton, 75 plus division.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: You're over 75 years old?

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: 82 November first. How much is the prize money?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: There's no prize money.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: What, is any of this real?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Check that out. [points to Toby] Look at me, I'm Toby, I'm stretching, I know what I'm doing. Why is he even here?

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: So I heard that you were peeping on Michael.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What? Look, no it was not...

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: I don't know what your deal is, but he's mine, OK? So hands off.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK everybody, listen up. Thank you for coming. Before we get started I wanted to say a few words about this deadly disease called rabies. And I'd like you to take a look into the face of rabies. [turns around a picture of Meredith in the hospital] That should scare you. It scares me. You people need to educate yourselves. Myth: 3 Americans every year die from rabies. Fact: 4 Americans every year die from rabies. How many of you know someone who has been afflicted or affected by rabies? Show of hands. One, two, three... too many to count. It is truly the silent killer. No, it is the foaming barking killer. And it is something... Darryl what are you doing.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [feeding a squirrel] I'm giving him a peanut.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, don't give him... just, did you hear anything I said?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Look how happy he is.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: He's happy because he's insane. You know what, that's the perfect example of the kind of awareness we need to generate. Where's the nurse? [Elizabeth walks up in nurse's outfit] This is the reason we're here.

quotes.speaker: Elizabeth
quotes.text: Hello Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh hey, I know you... Elizabeth?

quotes.speaker: Elizabeth
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Right? Wow, very cool you went back and got your degree. I would like you to accept this check, for $340.00 made out to science. Make sure that, that gets into the right hands.

quotes.speaker: Elizabeth
quotes.text: Great. [everyone claps]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You got it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: OK, fettuccine alfredo, time to carbo-load.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just remember folks, it's not about winning, it is about finishing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: On your marks, get set...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [pulls Toby's pants down] Beow!

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hey! [extremely loud gunshot]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: On your left!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: You're doing great Michael, look at you go!

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: That's my boss! Yeah-ha baby!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am fast! I'm very fast! I'm like Forrest Gump, except I am not an idiot. [Creed, Stanley, and Oscar get into a cab]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Oh yes I will work out today. I will work out a way to avoid running for a stupid cause.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I've walked 2 marathons. Pretty sure I can handle a 5k. Key is drafting, eliminate wind resistance. [running right behind Kevin]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah. [laughs] Oh we're in last place.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, would you look at that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Darn it.

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Water? Water? [Toby gabs water, drinks, then throws back at Jan] Water babe?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no water for me. Not while rabies causes fear of water... solidarity!

quotes.speaker: Jan
quotes.text: Michael that's irrational.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Rabies victims... have to live with an irrational hatred of water their entire lives. So... least I could do.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh God! My nipples, it's starting.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: [Creed, Stanley, and Oscar sitting at a table] Can we get another round?

quotes.speaker: Waitress
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: So we've got what, another 20 minutes?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: More or less.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Hmmm...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That fettuccine is sitting in my stomach like a rock.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You've got nothing to worry about, I put Imodium in Toby's coffee before the race.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughs] Excellent! ...Simpsons. Wait, Imodium or Ex-lax?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I'm makin' great time. Usually I have to take a bathroom break half way through a race like this, but not today.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ooo! An estate sale. Wanna go in?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't know I'm really committed to winning.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK, but what if I told you all the money you spend here, goes to preventing a disease that's already been cured.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mmm... Yes.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's what I thought.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Right. Let's do some good.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [Ryan looks at the phone as it rings... [Pam's voice] [You have reached the offices of Dunder-Mifflin, Scranton, currently the entire staff is out doing the Michael Scott, DM FM PMC rabies awareness Pro-Am fun run race... [Michael's voice] for the cure... [Pam's voice] leave a message" Ryan hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [Burp] Oh God, Oh, alfredo sauce. I'm getting a stitch. [groans]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [runs into the back of Kevin] Ah, God watch the nipples, Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Back off me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: How ya feeling, better?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well you look cute as a button. You've worked up quite a sweat.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: The vet is removing all of Sprinkles organs right now and sending them to the lab.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I am a farmer Angela.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: What does that mean?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: OK, when a farmer sees an animal that is in pain, that has no quality of life, that has no utility, a farmer does what city folk don't have the stomach to do.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You did kill her!?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I... I sang her, her favorite songs.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You put her in my freezer.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It was beautiful and gentle and respectful. I fed her antihistamines and she gradually fell asleep.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Well then she barfed them up in the freezer and tried to get out.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well I'm not responsible for that!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You! [hits Dwight]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, Oww! [looks around to onlookers] It's OK.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It's OK.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's nothing, I'm robbing her.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It's nothing.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's fine. What?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: How could you do that without telling me?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I thought I was helping you. I expected a hug. I took care of that cat, the best way I knew how.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Cat Heaven is a beautiful place, but you don't get there if you're euthanized.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I know a great taxidermist. I'll pay to have her stuffed. Well he's not great, but he's pretty good.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: You don't understand.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [runs by] Take bat bites seriously. Don't get bit.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Or we can have her buried out at the east field, by mother. Huh, Angela?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Don't touch me Dwight! [runs off crying]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [holding lamp] You like it? It's kinda designy and cool, it was $8.00.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, and I get to carry it.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [crosses finish line] And the winner is Toby Flenderson.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Have a seat, I'll write it down.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Where are we?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I dunno, like 5 kilometers from the office.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: He couldn't have made it a circle?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [bent over] I am not going to finish. I can't beat rabies. Nobody can beat rabies, rabies has been around for a thousand years. I was a fool to think that I could beat it. [Creed,Stanley, and Oscar pass by in the cab and get out at the finish line]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: ...talk about it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah probably. Hey, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What are you doing here? Did you come back for us, or...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can't finish. I feel so weak, I just...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, you're probably dehydrated.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What do you want me to do Jim?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Glass of water would be a start.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, There are people all over the world, who have all sorts of problems and afflictions, and diseases. They're deformed, and they're abnormal, and... they're illiterate and ugly. Symphonies don't have any money. Public TV is bust. I can't do anything about it, I can't... you know. There's just one of me, and there's a thousand of them. And rabies wins.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow! You are a downer. We were having a pretty nice day.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm still having a nice day.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You are?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah. Hey Michael, look at this lamp. $8.00.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's a good deal.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And Michael, you don't have rabies. And chances are you're not going to get it anytime soon. So... you don't really have to think about it too much.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pam, if everybody felt that way, nothing would get done.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, but there's other, better people out there who are helping.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You just don't think I am capable, of making a difference.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know you Michael, I saw you naked.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You don't, you don't know me. You've just seen my penis. I can make a difference, remember, I'm the one who started this whole thing off by hitting Meredith with my car. And I owe it to her to finish this... GD 5k [gets up groaning, Jim tries to help] No, no!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Finishing that 5k, was the hardest thing I have ever had to do. I ate more fettuccine alfredo and drank less water, than I have in my entire life. People always talk about triumphs of the human spirit, well today I had a triumph of the human body. That's why everybody was applauding for me at the end. My guts and my heart, and while I eventually puked my guts out, I never puked my heart out. And I'm very, very proud of that.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Hey Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey Mer. How ya doing?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Better.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's ironic isn't it? I mean I'm in the hospital for not getting enough water, and you're in it for a disease that causes the fear of water.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: I'm in because you hit me with your car. But I wanted to say, I heard you were trying really hard, so I'm not mad at you anymore.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thanks, I'm not mad at you anymore. [sighs, takes sucker out of his mouth] Wanna share?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm not really sick. [Meredith takes a lick and hands back to Michael] Nah, I'm good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Did you ever think of this?  Would a sober person walk in front of a car?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ay-o!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm sorry, are you saying that Meredith was drunk at 9 AM?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well...

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: That's despicable.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Michael.

quotes.speaker: Someone
quotes.text: That's not cool.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: There's no proof of that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's not...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: That seems early, even for her.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's not what...no, no, I'm not saying that, that's disgusting.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Drunk?  No!  You can't get drunk off Kahlua.  It's just a kind of coffee.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Then... what are you saying?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am saying... that... maybe I was drunk.  Did you ever think of that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Definitely not.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: That'd be DUI.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: That's...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Maybe she hit me.  You ever think of that?  She hit me?  I don't know whose fault it was.  I wasn't exactly looking at the road.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Toby. [walks past him to Kelly's cubicle]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Kelly, we're going to visit Meredith at lunch.  [Kelly's lying down on floor, head unseen under desk.  She rolls to her side, away from Pam]  Kelly?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Well, Kelly's been so upset about Ryan dumping her, that she can't even talk. [grins]

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [from under desk]  I don't want to talk to anybody about Ryan!  Please, go away!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: They don't have this kind of technology at the vet's.  It's not far.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It's fair.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what, why don't go around the room and say one memory of Meredith.  I'll start.  I liked her jumpers.  They reminded me of Kindergarten.  Jim?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I'll always remember Meredith's back.  That's all I can see from my desk.  All that red hair, over a nice strong back.  Sometimes I pretend it's Carrot Top, and he's going to turn around and tell a joke.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: So, how's the view old girl?  [looking out windows]  Oh!  There's a cemetery.  You think that's affiliated with the hospital, or is it a like a separate feature...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey! Okay, okay, okay,    You can just close that.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Bye, Meredith.  Here you go.  We got you some balloons.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: See you guys. [chorus of goodbyes, all but Michael file out as he's talking, Creed takes Meredith's pills]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Let's just... Why can't you just forgive... Why, why are you having such a hard time laughing this off?  How do you know that you weren't born with some sort of abnormal pelvis that it was just bound to crack at some point?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Oh please, Michael.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm not going to leave until you forgive me.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: You're gonna be here a long time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [standing for a while, sighs, turns to walk out] Oh, okay.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Nurse!  I just need some water.  And my pills.  Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Nurse
quotes.text: There you go.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: There's nothing in here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This office is cursed.  [sighs]  And we need to do something about it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Conference room?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Maybe the conference room, maybe the annex.  I'm just saying, at least right here [indicates floor in front of his office] is cursed.  Conference room, 10 minutes.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: On the one hand, it's a relief to know that it's not just me, the whole office is cursed.  On the other hand, I may have to deal with the dark unknown.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Question: Has anyone recently offended a Gypsy?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We have to have done something wrong.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: You ran over an employee.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That was the curse, Stanley, and we are trying to find the cause of the curse.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mmm.  [nods]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oscar, are you Santaria?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I was raised Catholic, but I'm agnostic now, so I guess I'm a secular humanist.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh.  Great.  We have a secular humanist here, that is disgusting.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Michael, do you know what secular humanism is?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.  It is a philosophy which says people can improve their lives by using reason instead of religion or superstition.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stupid.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: My cousin Mose's best friend was a dog.  One day, he was foaming at the mouth, so I had to shoot him dead.  Turns out, he had only eaten one of Mose's cream pies.  Did I feel bad for killing him?  No.  That's how you deal with a thief.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, the, uh, the charity's having some financial problems.  What do I look like to you, Paul Newman?  That's actually not a good example, because I have been compared to a young Paul Newman, my eyes and my face.  And I make my own salad dressing.  I mix Newman's Ranch with Newman's Italian.  Sell it at flea markets for a slight loss.  I could make... I could make a profit if I changed one of the ingredients to Wishbone [shakes head] but I won't do it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Whoa, 'scuse me!  Oh!

quotes.speaker: Bob Vance
quotes.text: Let... let's pick it up, Phyllis!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, slow!  Oh, ho, ho, ho. [laughing as he passes Phyllis and Bob]  You guys are going so slow...

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Go get him Bobby!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Come on, I'm going backwards.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Sic him!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, all right!  All right!  All right!  All right!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Sic him!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay! [Bob Vance and Michael in an all-out sprint, Michael grunting]

quotes.speaker: Pediatrician
quotes.text: You're gonna be just fine, Michael!  You're gonna have a good life.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Pediatrician
quotes.text: Lots of people suffer dehydration; they all recover just fine.

quotes.speaker: Pediatrician
quotes.text: I'm Michael's pediatrician.  Dehydration's pretty simple.  He could also have been treated by a Boy Scout leader, a coach, or a, a... a water bottle.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, apparently, my insurance will not be covering this hospital stay.  I will be paying out-of-pocket.  Um... I kinda wish I'd been hit by a car.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, doc?  You forgetting something? [pediatrician takes a lollypop from his pocket and gives it to Michael]  Thank you.
